intro: Pavetta crebrifolia var. crebrifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pavetta, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. This variant is distinguished by its dense foliage and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
